message.content: This question tests knowledge about the composition of gasoline. Gasoline is a petroleum-based fuel, which is made from crude oil. Crude oil is a fossil fuel, formed over millions of years from the remains of ancient plants and animals. Therefore, to produce gasoline, raw materials such as fossilized matter are necessary. Option (A) is incorrect because although air is necessary for combustion, it is not a raw material in the production of gasoline. Option (B) is incorrect because water is not involved in the formation of gasoline. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is not a raw material in gasoline production.

This question requires basic knowledge about the production of gasoline. Gasoline is a fuel that is made from fossilized matter, such as crude oil. Without the addition of these raw materials, gasoline would not exist. Option (A) is incorrect because while air is required for combustion, it is not a raw material needed to produce gasoline. Option (B) is incorrect because water is not used in the production of gasoline. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is not a raw material used to make gasoline.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the composition of gasoline. Gasoline is a fossil fuel, which means it is derived from the remains of ancient organisms (fossilized matter). Therefore, the addition of fossilized matter, in the form of petroleum or crude oil, is necessary for gasoline to exist. Option (A) is incorrect because air is not a raw material needed for gasoline. Option (B) is incorrect because water is not a component of gasoline. Option (C) is incorrect because sand is also not used in the production of gasoline.

Option (A) is incorrect because air is not a raw material for gasoline production. Option (B) and (C) are also incorrect because water and sand are not involved in the production of gasoline.
